posts.title: Finland turns down US request for eggs
top_comments: Maybe JD didn’t say please

So let me get this straight....

You expect to get something you need from someone you've pissed off?

”US authorities have turned to Europe for help with the country's severe egg shortage. The shortfall is due to bird flu, which has plagued the United States for several years.

The Finnish Poultry Association says it has been contacted about exporting eggs to the US. The organisation's executive director, Veera Lehtilä, told Yle on Saturday that exporting eggs does not seem to be possible at the moment because no market access negotiations have been held with US authorities. This can be a drawn-out process involving extensive inspections and studies.”

1. Fuck everyone, we’re not subsidizing any of you anymore, you’re not even a real country, America first, USA, USA, etc. etc.

2. Can we have some eggs please? 


Can’t make this shit up.

There is little to no goodwill left for the US in Europe. No eggs for you. 


The US spent 80 years building up their role as a big brother to the western world, recognized as the leader of the free world.


It took Trump 3 weeks to destroy its reputation, and it will probably take several generations to make it "great again"
Coming soon: *"Nasty people in Finland, maybe we're looking at it becoming a US state..."*
You don’t have the cards

Any dealings in that magnitude has to be done through an EU negotiated trade agreement. 
And considering that the US has just started a trade war with the EU and threatens to invade EU territory.. that's gonna be a no from us dawg.

Imagine how much cheaper things would get if we just worked with allies instead of pissing them off.

It’s all a show. The current administration has no plans on making the lives of Americans better. Same with doge. Cost cutting that cuts 02% of federal budget. America strong economic policy that makes us weak.
You could ask Canada... oh, wait.

posts.title: US deports hundreds of Venezuelans despite court order
top_comments:
We didn’t deport them to Venezuela though. We paid El Salvador to imprison them in some sort of work camp super max prison site situation

[bet the range of people and dissidents exported here grows](https://x.com/nayibbukele/status/1901245427216978290?s=46)

How? I thought by avoiding shutdown the courts would still be functioning and they would stop Trump in his tracks. Schumer said so.

How can he just ignore the court orders, that's not following the rules. I guess no one could have anticipated that.
Fine, we can't arrest the president for giving illegal order? Arrest the people that carry them out.

Time to start holding people in prison for contempt. When there are worse repercussions to the lawyers and administrators defying court orders than possibly losing their jobs, they'll stop defying them. Checks and balances, the executive can't be free to ignore the judiciary.
Our government ultimately relies on the assumption that the POTUS will fulfill his Constitutional obligations. We do not have that now. We have a criminal.

I think we are burying the lede

>Bukele wrote that the detainees were immediately transferred to El Salvador’s Terrorism Confinement Center (Cecot) “for a period of one year”, something that was “renewable” - suggesting they could be held there for longer.
>“The United States will pay a very low fee for them, but a high one for us,” he added.

We are paying (a lot it sounds like) for other countries to run our internment camps
Ladies and gentlemen: the "Party of Law and Order", once more fully displaying that they do not, in fact, give a shit about laws.
Looks like we got a good ol' fashioned constitutional crisis on our hands. Grab the pitchforks.

Wouldn’t the Alien Enemies Act of 1798 require the US to be at war for this to be legal deportations? Does this mean then that Congress gave a declaration of war to both Mexico and Venezuela which is what the constitution requires or is Trump violating the U.S. constitution that he swore to uphold?
How did they come to determine these were “gang members?”

posts.title: Brown Medicine professor, doctor deported to Lebanon despite having valid visa, court filings claim
top_comments: We have a deep Lebanese community and a need for doctors here in Canada!
Wouldn’t be surprised if she never comes back, can’t blame her. The brain drain we are seeing is gonna be legendary, except in a terrifying way.
Watch immigration officers not let her back in for some bullshit reason.

There’s a fellow in our office from Mexico who is winding down his time here in preparation for his medical residency. I just found out he has to go back home to update his visa from doing his service hours with us, to one for his residency. I worry that there will be “some problem or the other” and he won’t be let back in and there goes one more good man and good young doctor.
The one expected deportation that hasn’t happened yet is the Statue of Liberty.
Exactly what we need when we are lacking pediatricians and primary care doctors
Has anything this administration done so far actually been beneficial for anyone but themselves?
“Brown Medicine” isn’t what they think it is.

> “Our CBP Officers adhere to strict protocols to identify and stop threats, using rigorous screening, vetting, strong law enforcement partnerships, and keen inspectional skills to keep threats out of the country,” Hilton Beckham, CBP’s assistant commissioner of public affairs, said in the statement. 

So… what was the threat here?
There’s a good chance that there is more to this story than what is in the article. This is intended to enrage the reader and sow discord.

posts.title: Fishermen sue San Diego’s Bumble Bee Foods for forced labor, abuse
top_comments:
So, to save some people a click... Bumble Bee Foods itself isn't the one that is accused of wrongdoing, but one of the companies in its supply chain. Specifically some boat captain around Indonesia. 

Assuming the reports that the people were beaten, stabbed, and suffered various other injuries, they absolutely are owed some justice, but going after Bumble Bee Foods in this specific instance seems like an effort to go after the deeper pockets. Now, if they have evidence Bumble Bee knew about these practices and didn't cut ties with the company, then that would definitely change things. Of course the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act doesn't really make a distinction between whether you knew someone you were doing business with was doing something illegal. 

I just hope the people who did the actual beating and stabbing were subjected to the full extent of the law.
I will always stand by labor in their struggle against industry.
I may be wrong...but wasn't it tuna fisherman and labor questions at the source of the original Chevron ruling by the Supreme Court?
That’s why we at Schooner Tuna are reducing the price of our tuna by 50 cents a can.

Thank goodness these workers are getting the chance to fight back. Full context for this would take way too much time to explain (I've contributed to a 40-page paper on human rights violations in the seafood industry), so here's a very basic summary. The seafood industry is wrought with criminal activity ranging from theft/misrepresentation to forced labor/genuine slavery. Bumble Bee and their parent company, FCF, are some of the biggest abusers of modern-day slavery.

The common practice is to hire a ship from another country (usually China, Taiwan, or the Phillipines). That ship hires laborers in a country that has lots of cheap labor (usually Indonesia or Cambodia). Once these people are hired and on the ship, the ship goes out to sea for months, if not years. These workers are stuck without any way to contact their homes and no guarantee that their wages are getting to their families. They're forced to work long hours in unsafe and unsanitary conditions with just enough food to keep them alive. I am not exaggerating when I say complaints are often met with a beating or a bullet to the head. After all that, if the ship does finally dock (which is often delayed due to transshipment and is often only happening for repairs or changing flags at ports of convenience), the workers aren't allowed onto shore or they might get [abandoned in a foreign country](https://apnews.com/article/abandoned-seafarers-labor-unpaid-wages-oceans-83ad0a42debbaf67c18373393fcea753).

On top of all this, going back to the recruiting process, most honest recruitment agencies know about this and do what they can to prevent people from getting enslaved. So, the companies that are doing this are often connected to organized crime or terrorist organizations. Corruption is a major issue in Indonesia, [especially in their seafood industry](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-11-27/rolex-watches-seized-as-indonesian-minister-arrested-corruption/12922796). Fighting back against this is extremely risky.

These workers are extremely brave as they're potentially facing corruption in multiple countries, organized crime, and massive corporations. Going after Bumble Bee will be difficult as the US doesn't have many laws that can be used to make Bumble Bee liable for human rights violations down its supply chain. If we had many laws for this, Nestlé would've been taken down a long time ago. The contents of the article detail the abuse they faced but didn't clarify the nationality of the captain and registry of the ship. I hope the best for these workers.

Also, I haven't looked into human rights groups addressing the seafood industry in Indonesia, but if you'd like to help, I recommend [Destructive Fishing Watch - Indonesia](https://dfw.or.id/english-page/).They support workers and fisheries in adopting sustainable fishing practices while providing on the ground resources to those caught in human rights abuses. When I worked with them, they were a little more on the environmental side of things, but it looks like they've been successful in expanding their efforts to organize and represent laborers. Their 2024 report outlines some of the success they've had addressing human rights violations as part of their second strategy. Give them some love so they can keep fighting the good fight!
As god as my witness, I saw the headline and immediately thought of Bee Movie.

top_comments: I wonder what percentage of these people rescued at sea just say fuck it and never get on a boat again...

Christopher Columbus named The Cayman Islands Los Tortugas because of all the sea turtles there.
Wait, were they EATING them, or just, ya know, surviving ON (top of) them?
I think I read this book
Cockroaches, birds and turtles.  I wonder if he was able to cook this stuff on his boat?  As a fisherman I wonder why he didn’t just catch and eat fish.
I wonder if he likes turtles in a cuisine sense now.
Perhaps stuffing his face with turtles was his plan all along? I think there was a bit on QI about giant tortoises being extremely delicious.
Saved by the turtle gods.
Meanwhile people tap out of Alone after 2days of no fish. This dude is resilient
its the guy from the turtle soup problem

posts.title: Olympic boxing gender row a result of Russian fake news, says IOC chief | Olympic Games
top_comments:
yea, no shit. Russia and the IBA are intertwined and the IBA is still pissed they lost control over the Olympics. Of course they were gonna start shit. And now that World Boxing is taking over, we can expect Russia and the IBA to start fake news crap with them too.

The Imane Khelif thing was especially bullshit when women who had fought her (Amy Broadhurst, Kellie Harrington) not only defeated her in matches but also supported her and said she didn't fight any differently from any other woman. But nobody listened to them or cared to watch those matches that showed it was just a regular female boxer fighting just like every other female boxer.
Cool. So is Piers Morgan going to retract all previous accusations that he spent months hammering his panelists about? Or should Imane just sue him for half his net worth in a defamation suit?
Literally everyone pointed this out when it was happening

The hysteria surrounding transgender people in sports is so ridiculous. A bunch of gray haired politicians are bitching about rights and fairness for athletes and the purity of the sport! 

It’s weird how the athletes aren’t up in arms about this. Almost like it’s not a real problem.
Yea, no shit, and the dumb motherfuckers bought it yet again.

It may have started from russia but let's not shove under a rug the deplorable contributions of right wing pundits from the west like JK Rowling or american media, they are just as guilty for peddling this.

Of course it was and came out of Russia.


Russia has been playing the American public on both thr right and left since Trump came on scene. 


But republicans politicians are perfectly fine with using that Russian propaganda to fuck I've America as long as they get power.
You mean JK Rowling and other TERFs were wrong ***yet again***!? Such a surprise!

Yeah and idiots like Trump and Rowling fell for it or continued to spread this news. Trump we get, he is an asset. People like Rowling and Joe Rogan have personal issues on it and them go crazy when someone pushes it in the news.
No shit. The IOC never entertained any of this anyway.

top_comments: Maybe JD didn’t say please

You expect to get something you need from someone you've pissed off?

”US authorities have turned to Europe for help with the country's severe egg shortage. The shortfall is due to bird flu, which has plagued the United States for several years.

The Finnish Poultry Association says it has been contacted about exporting eggs to the US. The organisation's executive director, Veera Lehtilä, told Yle on Saturday that exporting eggs does not seem to be possible at the moment because no market access negotiations have been held with US authorities. This can be a drawn-out process involving extensive inspections and studies.”

1. Fuck everyone, we’re not subsidizing any of you anymore, you’re not even a real country, America first, USA, USA, etc. etc.

There is little to no goodwill left for the US in Europe. No eggs for you.

It took Trump 3 weeks to destroy its reputation, and it will probably take several generations to make it "great again"

Assuming the reports that the people were beaten, stabbed, and suffered various other injuries, they absolutely are owed some justice, but going after Bumble Bee Foods in this specific instance seems like an effort to go after the deeper pockets. Now, if they have evidence Bumble Bee knew about these practices and didn't cut ties with the company, then that would definitely change things. Of course the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act doesn't really make a distinction between whether you knew someone you were doing business with was doing something illegal. 

I just hope the people who did the actual beating and stabbing were subjected to the full extent of the law.
I will always stand by labor in their struggle against industry.
I may be wrong...but wasn't it tuna fisherman and labor questions at the source of the original Chevron ruling by the Supreme Court?
That’s why we at Schooner Tuna are reducing the price of our tuna by 50 cents a can.

Thank goodness these workers are getting the chance to fight back. Full context for this would take way too much time to explain (I've contributed to a 40-page paper on human rights violations in the seafood industry), so here's a very basic summary. The seafood industry is wrought with criminal activity ranging from theft/misrepresentation to forced labor/genuine slavery. Bumble Bee and their parent company, FCF, are some of the biggest abusers of modern-day slavery.

The common practice is to hire a ship from another country (usually China, Taiwan, or the Phillipines). That ship hires laborers in a country that has lots of cheap labor (usually Indonesia or Cambodia). Once these people are hired and on the ship, the ship goes out to sea for months, if not years. These workers are stuck without any way to contact their homes and no guarantee that their wages are getting to their families. They're forced to work long hours in unsafe and unsanitary conditions with just enough food to keep them alive. I am not exaggerating when I say complaints are often met with a beating or a bullet to the head. After all that, if the ship does finally dock (which is often delayed due to transshipment and is often only happening for repairs or changing flags at ports of convenience), the workers aren't allowed onto shore or they might get [abandoned in a foreign country](https://apnews.com/article/abandoned-seafarers-labor-unpaid-wages-oceans-83ad0a42debbaf67c18373393fcea753).

On top of all this, going back to the recruiting process, most honest recruitment agencies know about this and do what they can to prevent people from getting enslaved. So, the companies that are doing this are often connected to organized crime or terrorist organizations. Corruption is a major issue in Indonesia, [especially in their seafood industry](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-11-27/rolex-watches-seized-as-indonesian-minister-arrested-corruption/12922796). Fighting back against this is extremely risky.

These workers are extremely brave as they're potentially facing corruption in multiple countries, organized crime, and massive corporations. Going after Bumble Bee will be difficult as the US doesn't have many laws that can be used to make Bumble Bee liable for human rights violations down its supply chain. If we had many laws for this, Nestlé would've been taken down a long time ago. The contents of the article detail the abuse they faced but didn't clarify the nationality of the captain and registry of the ship. I hope the best for these workers.

Also, I haven't looked into human rights groups addressing the seafood industry in Indonesia, but if you'd like to help, I recommend [Destructive Fishing Watch - Indonesia](https://dfw.or.id/english-page/).They support workers and fisheries in adopting sustainable fishing practices while providing on the ground resources to those caught in human rights abuses. When I worked with them, they were a little more on the environmental side of things, but it looks like they've been successful in expanding their efforts to organize and represent laborers. Their 2024 report outlines some of the success they've had addressing human rights violations as part of their second strategy. Give them some love so they can keep fighting the good fight!
As god as my witness, I saw the headline and immediately thought of Bee Movie.
